CatDescriptText: Mrs. Kathryn Davis, 3444 Wiggins Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Which do you think people give priority recognition to, the acquisition of money or achievement?" answer reads: "In my opinion, people give the most recognition to the man who has money, regardless of how he got it, that is regardless of whether he stole it, got it from the rackets, or what have you. As long as he has plenty of money, everything is okay."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Kathryn Davis, wearing light colored flecked two button coat with collar and cuffs and light colored head scarf, standing in front of multicolor flecked stone wall, revolving door on right
